target_text: Shire greenery, elvish scripts, ancient maps, hobbit holes, rustic satchels, middle earth journey aesthetics, fantasy landscapes, hobbit aesthetic, Middle-earth aesthetics

name: Black Panther
bio: Black Panther, also known as T'Challa, is a Marvel Comics superhero and the king of Wakanda, a fictional African nation with advanced technology and culture. He embodies Afrofuturism and balances royal duty with heroic responsibility, fighting to protect both his people and the world.
target_text: vibranium glow, Afrofuturism, panther statues, Wakandan skyline, black panther aesthetic, black-gold strength

name: Captain America
bio: Captain America, or Steve Rogers, is a Marvel Comics superhero originally created as a patriotic supersoldier during World War II. After being frozen in ice, he awakens in the modern era and continues to serve as a moral leader and defender of justice in the Avengers.
target_text: vintage war posters, star shield motif, patriotic tones, 1940s fashion, military aesthetics, red-white-blue color scheme, captain america shield

name: Spider-Man
bio: Spider-Man, aka Peter Parker, is a Marvel Comics superhero known for his agility, intellect, and wit. Gaining spider-like abilities from a radioactive bite, he juggles his teenage life in New York City with crime-fighting, often exploring themes of responsibility and personal growth.
target_text: city rooftops, web patterns, red-blue contrast, photography gear, youthful heroism, NYC aesthetics, spider webs, spiderman aesthetics, spiderman comics

name: Elon Musk
bio: Elon Musk is a visionary entrepreneur and engineer known for founding and leading companies like SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink, and The Boring Company. He is a central figure in space exploration, electric vehicles, and futuristic innovations, often aiming to reshape the future of humanity.
target_text: rocket launches, SpaceX, futuristic cities, Tesla minimalism, Mars colonization, cyberpunk innovation, neural networks aesthetic

name: Jeff Bezos
bio: Jeff Bezos is the founder of Amazon and a major figure in the e-commerce and cloud computing revolutions. Under his leadership, Amazon became one of the world’s most powerful tech companies. He also founded Blue Origin, a space exploration company focused on commercial space travel.
target_text: ecommerce empire, Amazon innovation, cloud servers, warehouse drones, Blue Origin rockets, modern capitalism aesthetic

name: Mark Zuckerberg
bio: Mark Zuckerberg is the co-founder and CEO of Meta (formerly Facebook), a company that transformed global social interaction. He has expanded into virtual reality and the metaverse, aiming to shape the future of human connection through digital environments.
target_text: social networks, facebook aesthetic, virtual reality headsets, metaverse design, hoodie simplicity, blue tech visuals, digital connection themes, social media aesthetics

name: Steve Jobs
bio: Steve Jobs was the co-founder and iconic leader of Apple Inc. He revolutionized consumer electronics with the Macintosh, iPod, iPhone, and iPad, pioneering sleek product design and intuitive user interfaces. Jobs is remembered as a visionary who merged technology with artistry.
target_text: black turtleneck symbolism, Apple minimalism, glass design language, innovation mindset, tech simplicity, keynote aesthetics

name: Bill Gates
bio: Bill Gates is the co-founder of Microsoft and a pivotal figure in the personal computing revolution. After transitioning from tech, he became a leading philanthropist through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, focusing on global health, education, and sustainability.
target_text: early Windows UI, Gates Foundation visuals, global innovation maps, philanthro-tech, vintage coding, legacy software symbolism

name: Nikola Tesla
bio: Nikola Tesla was a brilliant inventor, physicist, and electrical engineer known for his revolutionary contributions to alternating current (AC) electricity, wireless transmission, and electromagnetism. His eccentric persona and visionary experiments have made him a symbol of scientific genius and innovation.
target_text: lightning coils, retro lab experiments, old-world electricity, eccentric genius mood, Victorian tech fusion, plasma energy, electrical engineering aesthetics

name: Friedrich Nietzsche
bio: Friedrich Nietzsche was a German philosopher known for his provocative critiques of morality, religion, and culture. He developed influential ideas like the Übermensch, eternal recurrence, and the famous proclamation 'God is dead', shaping existentialist and postmodern thought.
target_text: existential shadows, overgrown ruins, lone thinkers, typewritten aphorisms, Existential nihilism, mountain solitude, vintage philosophy books, God is dead quote

name: Karl Marx
bio: Karl Marx was a German philosopher, economist, and revolutionary socialist. He co-authored 'The Communist Manifesto' and developed the theory of historical materialism, laying the foundation for Marxism and influencing global politics and labor movements.
target_text: 19th century germany aesthetic, industrial smokestacks, tattered manifestos, working-class symbolism, marxism aesthetic, ink-stained revolutions, dim factories, red banners, utopian blueprints, Communist Manifesto

name: John Locke
bio: John Locke was a British philosopher widely regarded as the father of liberalism. His writings on natural rights, the social contract, and empiricism profoundly shaped Enlightenment thought and the development of modern democratic theory.
target_text: 17th century quill writing, 17th century britain aesthetic, Enlightenment parlors, aged parchment, vintage inkwell collections, candlelit essays

name: Al-Ghazali
bio: Al-Ghazali was a Persian philosopher, theologian, jurist, and mystic whose works bridged Islamic theology and Sufi spirituality. His writings, especially 'The Incoherence of the Philosophers', profoundly influenced Islamic thought and integrated reason with faith.
target_text: Islamic Golden Age, Sufi mysticism, divine geometry, modest lamps, ash-colored wisdom, arabic calligraphy, islamic philosophy

name: Ibn Khaldun
bio: Ibn Khaldun was a North African historian, philosopher, and sociologist, best known for his pioneering work 'Muqaddimah'. He introduced early concepts of historiography, economics, and the cyclical nature of civilizations.
target_text: arabic calligraphy, islamic golden age, Muqaddimah manuscript, cyclical history maps, history maps aesthetic, Maghreb medinas

name: Vincent van Gogh
bio: Vincent van Gogh was a Dutch post-impressionist painter whose emotionally charged and vibrant works, like 'Starry Night' and 'Sunflowers', deeply influenced modern art. His expressive brushwork and turbulent life became symbols of the tortured artistic soul.
target_text: swirling night skies, sunflower madness, post-impressionist brushwork, rustic solitude, bandaged self-portraits, emotional texture, van gogh aesthetics, starry night, vibrant yellows

name: Isaac Newton
bio: Isaac Newton was an English mathematician, physicist, and astronomer who formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation. His work 'Principia Mathematica' laid the foundation for classical mechanics and revolutionized scientific understanding.
target_text: apple under tree, classical science aesthetic, celestial mechanics, gravity aesthetics, prism light rays, parchment formulas, alchemical sketches, candlelit studies, Newtonian physics, vintage telescopes

name: Galileo Galilei
bio: Galileo Galilei was an Italian astronomer, physicist, and engineer known for his pioneering use of the telescope. He supported heliocentrism and faced the Inquisition for challenging established geocentric beliefs.
target_text: antique telescope, classical science aesthetic, star charts, Renaissance observatory, heliocentric symbols, inquisition tension, parchment notes, planetary sketches, scientific rebellion aesthetic

name: Marie Curie
bio: Marie Curie was a pioneering physicist and chemist who conducted groundbreaking research on radioactivity. She was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize and remains the only person to receive Nobel Prizes in two different sciences.
target_text: glowing test tubes, early lab glassware, radioactive minerals, chalkboard equations, Nobel prize glow, scientific perseverance, vintage chemistry aesthetic
